subject: Meet the Starks
event:
Here's the latest video treat from HBO: an introduction to the Starks of Winterfell.

<lj-embed id="136"/>

Some great footage of the kids in this one.  And the first glimpses of Robb, Varys, and a few of other stalwarts.  Cool stuff.

(Though I do feel the need to mention that the part where I'm saying how direwolves existed in the real world was originally followed by me saying that MY direwolves are much bigger than the actual prehistoric ones.  Just don't want anyone to go away thinking I believed actual real world direwolves were as large as ponies.  Everything's bigger in fantasy).

Anyway, hope you all enjoy seeing this as much as me.

Closer and closer...

comments.article: Cool stuff indeed.  Much impressed with the cast and how much respect they have for their characters.

Was really struck by the same thing-I am sure all actors have to research their roles to one degree or another, but these folks seems really aware of the little things that make them unique.  The comment by "Robb" about how difficult it was to be a Stark AND a man really showed an understanding of hs legacy and his place in the larger picture of things...
comments.subject: Actors

comments.article: I saw this earlier, but it let me to the "Meet the Artisan" clips, which are really, really cool.
Large as ponies?  I'm sure I read that, but I always picture the wolves not much larger than regular ones.
Depends of course on which book we're talking about.  They start as newborn pups, after all.  And grow.  And Grow.  And GROW.

comments.subject: Will HBO be using CG effects for grown DireWolves?

comments.article: This looks fantastic! So looking forward to watching it :)

Really wish these videos worked for Canada. =( I looked on the HBO websites and it's not up there(that I found anyway). Anyone know if it's on youtube or something? I tried searching for it but no luck.
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e4sTrjgDacI?
Jon Snow looks much older then in books

I'm not 100% sure, not even 90%... but i think that i heared from a cousin who knows somebody at work that has a sister who works in a midschool where someone said that GRRM might have said that if he had the choice he would make the kids older... because they act and behave 2-4 years older them they are.
this might also be a reason why jon looks older :)

by the way... i loved all trailers up to this moment... i'm so excited... even if germany is problably the only **** country where we can't see GoT!!! (HATE IT!!!!!!!!)
Wonderful, all heroes are like I imagined when I was reading the book long time ago!

comments.upictitle: i am ringo starr: [TTGL] and you kissed me right there
comments.article: I think what gets me is just how much the actors look like the Starks I had in my mind. I admit that initially Sean Bean made me chuckles because I associate him with his Lord of the Rings role, but he is Ned Stark. Same with all the others, they don't just "inhabit" the skin of their characters, they are those characters.

Indeed, I was just thinking that Sansa is just perfect. I know the HBO character is a tad older than her novel version, but that actress looks JUST LIKE how I envision her.


One of the (slight) disappointments for me is that I was thrilled by Jennifer Ehle as Catelyn that I imprinted upon her as my mind's eye Catelyn and am a tad 'enh' about the (perfectly fine) Michelle Farley.
The look of this is so right - and the North looks so cold, I really cannot wait to see this!  I hope I will be able to download...*shhhh don't tell*

Three things in this video made me squee like a little girl:
1 - The shot of Ned standing between the direwolf statues (for some reason, it came into my head that they're guarding the entrance to the crypts... I have no clue if that's true or not)
2 - The shot of Winterfell, with the crow in the foreground and the obvious broken tower in the background...
and
3 - Bran, running fearlessly along the top of said Broken Tower. :D

Is it April yet?!

This seems to be shaping up to be fairly faithful adaptation. So glad you have a hand in the production. I am a HUGE fan but was going to wait for Blu-Ray as I do not have cable...I have now talked my father into letting me pay for him to have HBO for the months that this is on. This show will be my one weakness! There are a few choice scenes that I can't WAIT to see on screen. A certain "coronation" comes to mind...
comments.subject: Looks Fantastic

comments.article:
Rickon at least!

My god, how amazing video! I adore the kids, really, specially Isaac Hempstead-Wright. Amazing.

Just can´t wait!

Please sir, I want some more!
Awesome clip. I'd love to see the Lannisters featured as well. However, doing that might get too far into highlights from the middle/end of the series...

Not that Jon is a son, but of the blood...

Not quite the same as saying The Hound is Dead, Sandor Clegane is at rest, but come on, we know the Dragon has three heads...

comments.article: That Arya is a stroke of casting genius.
